title: Drag force - force at two-thirds terminal speed

content.question: A ball of mass <math alttext="m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is dropped from a height of one kilometer above the ground and falls vertically. The ball experiences a drag force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub d equals, k sub 0, end sub, times v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>d</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="k sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is a constant and <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> is the ball’s speed. When the ball’s speed is two-thirds of its terminal speed, what is the magnitude of the net force on the ball?

choices.label: <math alttext="one third m sub 0, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>g</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="four ninths m sub 0, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>9</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>g</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="five ninths m sub 0, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>9</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>g</mi></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="two thirds m sub 0, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>g</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="five ninths m sub 0, end sub, times g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>9</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>g</mi></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
